supported.__INFO__: you may adjust this value to support more/less types I have not thought about.

extension.__INFO__: best to use mkv, it is new, supports a lot of media types and safer. mp4 is for compatibility. webm extension might require you to have audio not set to copy.

name.__INFO__: name only: clean anything that it is not [a-z 0-9 dash underscore] (for example whitespace), which will be replaced with single underscore character. optionally append current data/time or 20-random-characters (cryptographically secure) generated, hex-range 0 to F.

video.__INFO__: mkv supports libx265/libx264/libvpx-vp9. mp4 supports libx265/libx264. webm supports libvpx-vp9.

audio.__INFO__: choosing and empty string will delete the [-c:a ##ENCODER_AUDIO## ] part of the command-line template, and ffmpeg will choose audio encoding automatically according to the output extension (mkv/mp4 will auto-choose aac, webm will auto-choose libopus). it is best to keep using copy since audio encoding is not required. you may choose a specific audio encoder yourself.

command.template: -y -hide_banner -err_detect ignore_err -stats -threads 16 -loglevel info -strict experimental -flags -output_corrupt -fflags +autobsf+discardcorrupt -flags2 +ignorecrop -loop 1 -i "##INPUT_IMAGE##" -i "##INPUT_AUDIO##" -movflags +faststart+rtphint+dash+cmaf+empty_moov+frag_every_frame+frag_keyframe+separate_moof -zerolatency 1 -tune zerolatency -c:a ##ENCODER_AUDIO## -c:v ##ENCODER_VIDEO## -preset ultrafast -crf 30 -b:v 0 -row-mt 1 -shortest -vf fifo,format=pix_fmts=yuv420p,fps=fps=25 "##OUTPUT_VIDEO##"
command.__INFO__: the execute (in the resource-folder) and its arguments. you may try avidemux/mkvtoolnix/handbrake and an alternative command-line template.  exe.exe is a wrap around Windows ShellExecuteW.
